comments:
If I right-click on certain areas of the Eclipse IDE GUI, such as the editor window, or package explorer, a 'JVM has crashed' error appears, and the right cliking on these areas thereafter causes nothing to happen at all -- no menus, or anything.

This problem occurs for me even when Eclipse has no plugins, has a fresh workspace, has been cleaned with -clean, with eclipse-SDK-3.2M6-win32, eclipse-SDK-N20060405-0010-win32, eclipse-SDK-N20060403-0010-win32, etc.

This was in the .log file:

java.version=1.6.0-beta2

Command-line arguments:  -os win32 -ws win32 -arch x86

This bug is also present in eclipse-SDK-N20060408-0010-win32.
This bug is *not* present in eclipse-SDK-3.2M5a-win32.zip. So some alteration in the code thereafter must be causing this problem.
This bug is also present in eclipse-SDK-N20060410-0010-win32, which I tested today.

This is an incompatibility between ICU 3.4.3 and jdk1.6.0-b78. Please try running Eclipse with a 1.4 or 1.5 VM.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 134689 ***

traces.message: Can't map string pool offset 20273 to index
